title: The Gourmet's Dilemma
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Diseases - Prevention
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Emigration and immigration
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Greece - Emigration and immigration
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Australia - Emigration and immigration
abstract: A short sub-titled instructional animation produced by the Australian Commonwealth Film Unit educating new migrants about the hazards of transporting food to Australia.
description: A light hearted yet serious educational production highlighting to new migrants the strict quarantine precautions necessary against Foot and Mouth disease and other animal diseases being introduced into Australia. The film was originally presented with the options of Greek or Italian narration, we follow Nino and his family's passage to Australia. Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection
